definition: to provide transport/to accept the Mandate of Heaven/to acknowledge one's calling to be emperor
surname Cheng/Cheng (c. 2000 BC), third of the legendary Flame Emperors 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
to bear/to carry/to hold/to continue/to undertake/to take charge/owing to/due to/to receive
lit. to respond to heaven and suit the times (idiom); to rule according to the will of heaven/the Divine Right of kings

sentences.english: But the Dallas-based carrier isn't just looking at Boeing.
sentences.chinese: 但這家總部位於達拉斯的承運商不僅僅只是眷顧波音。

sentences.english: Such documents that are issued by the carrier shall not be negotiable.
sentences.chinese: 承運人簽發的此類單證不得轉讓。

sentences.english: NVOCC is also a carrier because it can open B/L.
sentences.chinese: 無船承運人也是承運人因爲他可以簽發提單。

sentences.english: NVOCC is also a carrier because it can open B/L.
sentences.chinese: 無船承運人也是承運人因爲他可以簽發提單。

sentences.english: the carrier against whom an action has been brought shall have the right to require the other carrier to join in the proceedings.
sentences.chinese: 被提起訴訟的承運人有權要求另一承運人蔘加應訴。

sentences.english: the carrier against whom an action has been brought shall have the right to require the other carrier to join in the proceedings.
sentences.chinese: 被提起訴訟的承運人有權要求另一承運人蔘加應訴。

sentences.english: The placement of dollies on carrier pallets can also easily be carried out after the palletizing process.
sentences.chinese: 安置承運人托盤推車上也可以輕易地進行後碼垛進程。

sentences.english: The result of that is much closer regulatory oversight on the transpacific carriers that is probably necessary.
sentences.chinese: 這種對跨太平洋承運人的管理監督是有必要的。

sentences.english: Allows a carrier to lawfully charge a negotiated, non-tariff rate.
sentences.chinese: 允許承運人合法地收取已達成協議的，非運價本運價。

sentences.english: You must provide this information by specific seat and row number.
sentences.chinese: 承運人必須提供這些特定的座位和排號的信息。

sentences.english: The carrier's li-ability for the delay in delivery of the goods shipped on deck is also discussed in this paper.
sentences.chinese: 同時，對承運人對艙面貨的遲延交付責任等作了討論。

sentences.english: Allows a carrier to lawfully charge a negotiated, non-tariff rate.
sentences.chinese: 允許承運人合法地收取已達成協議的，終止。

sentences.english: How does the factory ensure that all documents are accurate when given to the carrier or consolidator?
sentences.chinese: 廠家如何保證交給承運人的所有文件的準確性？

sentences.english: Liability for seaworthiness is one of"least legal obligations"of carriers.
sentences.chinese: 適航責任爲承運人的“最低法定義務”之一。

sentences.english: This insurance shall not inure to the benefit of the carrier or other bailee.
sentences.chinese: 本保險的權益承運人或其他受託人不得享受。

sentences.english: At last, the writer recommends to establish the NVOCC's liability insurance system in China. Lv Jing (International Law) Directed by Prof.
sentences.chinese: 最後，提出建立我國無船承運人責任保險制度的建議。

definition: security measures (esp. border security)/official seal (esp. military seal during Qing and Ming times)
imperial edict/see also 聖諭|圣谕[sheng4 yu4]
funds and provisions for the troops/(soldier's) pay
to forfeit sovereignty and humiliate the country (idiom)/to surrender territory under humiliating terms
Zhu Qizhen, personal name of sixth and eighth Ming emperor Zhengtong 正統|正统[Zheng4 tong3], afterwards Tianshun Emperor 天順|天顺[Tian1 shun4] (1427-1464), reigned 1435-1449 and 1457-1464
Nurhaci (1559-1626), founder and first Khan of the Manchu Later Jin dynasty 後金|后金 (from 1616)
